definitions.definition: A small hole or perforation, caused by piercing.
An indentation or small mark made with a pointed object.
A dot or other diacritical mark used in writing; a point.
A tiny particle; a small amount of something; a jot.
A small pointed object.
The experience or feeling of being pierced or punctured by a small, sharp object.
definitions.example: I felt a sharp prick as the nurse took a sample of blood.

definitions.definition: A feeling of remorse.
The penis.
Someone (especially a man or boy) who is unpleasant, rude or annoying.
A small roll of yarn or tobacco.
The footprint of a hare.
A point or mark on the dial, noting the hour.
The point on a target at which an archer aims; the mark; the pin.
To pierce or puncture slightly.
definitions.example: John hardly felt the needle prick his arm when the adept nurse drew blood.

definitions.definition: To form by piercing or puncturing.
definitions.example: to prick a pattern for embroidery

definitions.definition: To mark or denote by a puncture; to designate by pricking; to choose; to mark.
To mark the surface of (something) with pricks or dots; especially, to trace a ship’s course on (a chart).
To run a middle seam through the cloth of a sail.
To fix by the point; to attach or hang by puncturing.
definitions.example: to prick a knife into a board

definitions.definition: To be punctured; to suffer or feel a sharp pain, as by puncture.
To make or become sharp; to erect into a point; to raise, as something pointed; said especially of the ears of an animal, such as a horse or dog; and usually followed by up.
definitions.example: The dog's ears pricked up at the sound of a whistle.

definitions.definition: Usually in the form prick out: to plant (seeds or seedlings) in holes made in soil at regular intervals.
To incite, stimulate, goad.
To urge one's horse on; to ride quickly.
To affect with sharp pain; to sting, as with remorse.
To make acidic or pungent.
To become sharp or acid; to turn sour, as wine.
To aim at a point or mark.
Usually as prick up: to dress or adorn; to prink.
